remarks: The full subcategory generated by a subset of objects is the category with these objects and the same morphisms as the original.  The result is always a subcategory (and it is full, meaning that all morphisms of the original category between objects in the subcategory is also in the subcategory).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Jan-2017.)
statement:
fullsubc.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
fullsubc.h $e |- H = ( Homf ` C ) $.
fullsubc.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
fullsubc.s $e |- ( ph -> S C_ B ) $.
fullsubc $p |- ( ph -> ( H |` ( S X. S ) ) e. ( Subcat ` C ) ) $.
